content.description:
Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is not acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin.

An experiment was conducted to measure the reaction rate of the human salivary enzyme α-amylase. Ten mL of a concentrated starch solution and 1.0 mL of α-amylase solution were placed in a test tube. The test tube was inverted several times to mix the solution and then incubated at 25°C. The amount of product (maltose) present was measured every 10 minutes for an hour. The results are given in the table below.
content.question: Graph the data on the axes provided and calculate the rate of the reaction for the time period 0 to 30 minutes.

frqParts.text: Graph the data on the axes provided and calculate the rate of the reaction for the time period 0 to 30 minutes.

skill.text: 4.A: Construct a graph to represent the data, including: x-y graphs (bar, histogram, line, log scale, dual y), scatter plot, box and whisker plot, and pie chart. The graph should include the following components: i. type of graph appropriate for the data ii. axis labeling, including appropriate units and legend iii. scaling iv. accurately plotted data (including error bars when appropriate) v. trend line (when appropriate)
